Term.Name: A-LAW
Term.Definition: The 13 bits non-uniform coding scheme, as defined by G.711
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: MU-LAW
Term.Definition: The 14 bits non-uniform coding scheme, as defined by G.711
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: ATRAC
Term.Definition: The Adaptive Transform Acoustic Coding scheme as defined by Sony - Adaptive Transform Acoustic Coding
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: ATRAC2
Term.Definition: The Adaptive Transform Acoustic Coding scheme as defined by Sony - Adaptive Transform Acoustic Coding 2
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: ATRAC3
Term.Definition: The Adaptive Transform Acoustic Coding scheme as defined by Sony - Adaptive Transform Acoustic Coding3
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: DOLBY
Term.Definition: Any Dolby compression scheme as defined by Dolby Laboratories.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: DOLBY A
Term.Definition: The Dolby A compression scheme as defined by Dolby Laboratories.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: AC3
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: E-AC3
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: DOLBY B
Term.Definition: The Dolby B noise reduction scheme as defined by Dolby Laboratories.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: DOLBY C
Term.Definition: The Dolby C noise reduction scheme as defined by Dolby Laboratories.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: DOLBY E
Term.Definition: The Dolby E compression scheme as defined by Dolby Laboratories. This is 6 channels and metadata
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: DOLBY Pro-logic
Term.Definition: The Dolby Pro-logic compression scheme as defined by Dolby Laboratories. This is 4 channels.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: DOLBY Pro-logic II
Term.Definition: The Dolby Pro-logic II compression scheme as defined by Dolby Laboratories. This is 6 channels.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: DOLBY S
Term.Definition: The Dolby S noise reduction scheme as defined by Dolby Laboratories.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: DOLBY SR
Term.Definition: The Dolby SR noise reduction and recording scheme as defined by Dolby Laboratories.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: DOLBY Stereo
Term.Definition: The Dolby Stereo compression scheme as defined by Dolby Laboratories. This is for cinema.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: DOLBY Surround
Term.Definition: The Dolby Surround compression scheme as defined by Dolby Laboratories. This is 3 channels.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: DOLBY Digital Plus
Term.Definition: The Dolby Surround compression scheme as defined by Dolby Laboratories.
Term.ChangeComment: Alignment with tech 3285

Term.Name: DOLBY EX
Term.Definition: The Dolby Surround compression scheme as defined by Dolby Laboratories.
Term.ChangeComment: Alignment with tech 3285

Term.Name: DOLBY TRUEHD
Term.Definition: The Dolby compression scheme as defined by Dolby Laboratories.
Term.ChangeComment: MovieLabs mapping

Term.Name: DTS
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: DTS-ES
Term.ChangeComment: MovieLabs mapping

Term.Name: DTS-HRA
Term.ChangeComment: MovieLabs mapping

Term.Name: DTS-96/24
Term.ChangeComment: MovieLabs mapping

Term.Name: DTS-MA
Term.ChangeComment: MovieLabs mapping

Term.Name: G.72x
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: G.722
Term.Definition: standard wideband speech codec operating at 48-64 kbit/s. Technology of the codec is based on split band ADPCM.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: G.723
Term.Definition: is an extension of Recommendation G.721 adaptive differential pulse code modulation to 24 and 40 kbit/s for digital circuit multiplication equipment application.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: G.723.1
Term.Definition: audio codec for voice that compresses voice audio in 30 ms frames. An algorithmic look-ahead of 7.5 ms duration means that total algorithmic delay is 37.5 ms. Note that this is a completely different codec from G.723.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: G.726
Term.Definition: ADPCM speech codec standard covering the transmission of voice at rates of 16, 24, 32, and 40 kbit/s
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: G.728
Term.Definition: Speech coding operating at 16 kbit/s. Technology used is LD-CELP, Low Delay Code Excited Linear Prediction.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: G.729
Term.Definition: Speech Coding. The Sub-band ADPCM coding scheme, as defined by G.729
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: G.729.1
Term.Definition: 8-32 kbit/s embedded speech and audio coder providing bitstream interoperability with G.729.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: G.729.a
Term.Definition: Audio data compression algorithm for voice that compresses voice audio in chunks of 10 milliseconds.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: MPEG-1 Audio
Term.Definition: Compression is applied to audio producing an output according to International Standard ISO/IEC 11172-3 with the limitations given by the specified Layer I defined within the same standard.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: MPEG-1 Layer I
Term.Definition: Compression is applied to audio producing an output according to International Standard ISO/IEC 11172-3 with the limitations given by the specified Layer I defined within the same standard.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: MPEG-1 Layer II
Term.Definition: Compression is applied to audio producing an output according to International Standard ISO/IEC 11172-3 with the limitations given by the specified Layer II defined within the same standard. So called Musicam.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: MPEG-1 Layer III
Term.Definition: Compression is applied to audio producing an output according to International Standard ISO/IEC 11172-3 with the limitations given by the specified Layer III defined within the same standard.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: MPEG-2 AAC
Term.Definition: Advanced Audio Coding. Compression is applied to audio producing an output according to International Standard ISO/IEC 13818-7.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: MPEG-2 Audio AAC Low Complexity Profile
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: MPEG-2 Audio AAC Main Profile
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: MPEG-2 Audio AAC Sampling Rate Scalable Profile
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: MP3
Term.Definition: MP3 Audio Coding: MPEG-1 Layer III + MPEG-2 Low Sampling Rate Layer III
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: HE-AACv2
Term.ChangeComment: MovieLabs mapping

Term.Name: MPEG-2 Audio
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: MPEG-2 Layer I
Term.Definition: Compression is applied to audio producing an output according to International Standard ISO/IEC 13818-3 with the limitations given by the specified Layer I defined within the same standard.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: MPEG-2 Layer II
Term.Definition: Compression is applied to audio producing an output according to International Standard ISO/IEC 13818-3 with the limitations given by the specified Layer II defined within the same standard.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: MPEG-2 Layer III
Term.Definition: Compression is applied to audio producing an output according to International Standard ISO/IEC 13818-3 with the limitations given by the specified Layer IIIdefined within the same standard.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: MPEG-2 Audio Low Sampling Rate
Term.Definition: MPEG-2 Audio Low Sampling Rate according to International Standard ISO/IEC 13818-3, extension to MPEG-1 (sample rates half those of MPEG-1, bit rates from 8 kbps up to 256kbp)
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: MPEG-2 Audio Low Sampling Rate Layer I
Term.Definition: MPEG-2 Audio Low Sampling Rate Layer I according to International Standard ISO/IEC 13818-3
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: MPEG-2 Audio Low Sampling Rate Layer II
Term.Definition: MPEG-2 Audio Low Sampling Rate Layer II according to International Standard ISO/IEC 13818-3
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: MPEG-2 Audio Low Sampling Rate Layer III
Term.Definition: MPEG-2 Audio Low Sampling Rate Layer III according to International Standard ISO/IEC 13818-3
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Windows Media Audio (Wma)
Term.Definition: Variable Bit Rate (VBR), Constant Bit Rate (CBR) and lossless audio encoding. Compression is based on the Modified discrete cosine transform.
